channel.title: BBC News - Europe
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Spain migrants: Sole survivor rescued in dinghy in Atlantic
item.description: The woman, who was spotted clinging to an upturned boat, says at least 52 other people died.

item.title: Belgium stabbing suspect won’t be charged over unborn baby’s death
item.description: A man in Belgium is charged with allegedly stabbing his partner, but not her unborn baby's death.

item.title: Russia names Golos monitor as 'foreign agent' ahead of election
item.description: Golos has vowed to continue its work ahead of parliamentary elections in a month's time.

item.title: Trabzonspor 1-2 Roma: Jose Mourinho reign starts with European win
item.description: Jose Mourinho's spell as Roma boss starts with a win at Turkish side Trabzonspor in the Europa Conference League play-off.

item.title: Irish government to evacuate 36 citizens from Afghanistan
item.description: Three Irish citizens have been evacuated from the country so far, Ireland's foreign minister says.

item.title: Galway: Four dead after three-vehicle M6 collision
item.description: Police say all four people died at the scene of the three-vehicle collision on the M6.

item.title: Climate change: Does Germany produce double the UK's carbon emissions?
item.description: MP John Redwood claims that, on carbon emissions, Germany "puts out twice as much as we do". Is he right?

item.title: Venezia FC: The club built on water rising to the top of Italian football
item.description: The stunning Italian city of Venice is not normally associated with its football club, but that could be set to change as a 19-year wait for a return to Serie A comes to an end.

item.title: Peter Karlsson: The painful verdict on Swedish ice hockey player's 1995 killing
item.description: Peter Karlsson was stabbed to death in the street. His killer said he was protecting himself - via the so-called 'gay panic' defence.

item.title: Teenage pilot Zara Rutherford begins solo round-world record bid
item.description: Zara Rutherford completes the first leg of her journey from Belgium to England.

item.title: 'My night in Quisling's cabin'
item.description: When Ben McPherson realised he could rent Vidkun Quisling's cabin, it struck him as weird. His Norwegian wife disagreed.

item.title: Bardsey: Lure of the island with no electricity or wi-fi
item.description: There is no hot water or showers on the island, and it is thought that is why people are attracted.

item.title: Wildfires rage across Europe
item.description: A look at some of the fires spreading across Europe - and the rest of the globe.

item.title: Afghan reporter asks Nato secretary general for help
item.description: Lailuma Sadid, a journalist with Brussels Morning Newspaper, became emotional when asking the Nato secretary general about the Taliban in Afghanistan.

item.title: BBC presenter flees French fires
item.description: "It was very, very, very frightening," says Geeta Guru-Murthy.

item.title: The shopkeeper saving his island from wildfires
item.description: Spyros isn't a firefighter, but when his home was threatened with wildfires, he decided to take action.

item.title: Greece fires: Hundreds rescued by coastguard
item.description: The coastguard moved 650 people from Limni, in the north of the island of Evia.
